query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Di pari, come buoi che vanno a giogo, 2 m’andava io con quell’ anima carca, 3 fin che ’l sofferse il dolce pedagogo.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Side by side, like oxen yoked together, 2 I went with that burdened soul, 3 until the gentle master endured it.
**Malay:**
1 Beriringan, seperti lembu yang dibelenggu bersama, 2 aku berjalan dengan jiwa yang terbebani itu, 3 hingga guru yang lembut itu menahannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Come, perché di lor memoria sia, 17 sovra i sepolti le tombe terragne 18 portan segnato quel ch’elli eran pria,
19 onde lì molte volte si ripiagne 20 per la puntura de la rimembranza, 21 che solo a’ pïi dà de le calcagne;
22 sì vid’ io lì, ma di miglior sembianza 23 secondo l’artificio, figurato 24 quanto per via di fuor del monte avanza.
query.result:
**English:**
16 So that their memory may live on, 17 above the buried ones the tombs on the ground 18 bear a sign of what they were before,
19 so that there one often weeps 20 for the sting of remembrance, 21 which only gives spurs to those who are most alive;
22 thus I saw there, but of better appearance 23 according to the artistry, depicted 24 as much as projects beyond the path on the outside of the mountain.
**Malay:**
16 Agar kenangan mereka tetap hidup, 17 di atas mereka yang terkubur, makam-makam di tanah 18 menandakan siapa mereka sebelumnya,
19 sehingga di sana orang sering menangis 20 karena sengatan kenangan, 21 yang hanya memberi semangat kepada mereka yang paling hidup;
22 demikianlah yang kulihat di sana, tetapi dengan penampilan yang lebih baik 23 sesuai dengan kesenian, digambarkan 24 sebanyak yang menonjol di luar jalur di luar gunung.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Vedea colui che fu nobil creato 26 più ch’altra creatura, giù dal cielo 27 folgoreggiando scender, da l’un lato.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I saw the one who was nobly created, 26 more than any other creature, come down from heaven, 27 thundering, on one side.
**Malay:**
25 Melihat dia yang diciptakan dengan mulia, 26 lebih dari makhluk lainnya, turun dari surga, 27 menyambar, di satu sisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Vedëa Brïareo fitto dal telo 29 celestïal giacer, da l’altra parte, 30 grave a la terra per lo mortal gelo.
query.result:
**English:**
28 I saw Briareus, pierced by the celestial 29 thunderbolt, lying on one side, 30 heavy on the ground because of the deadly frost.
**Malay:**
28 Aku melihat Briareus, tertusuk oleh petir 29 surgawi, terbaring di sisi yang lain, 30 berat di tanah karena es yang mematikan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Vedea Timbreo, vedea Pallade e Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar le membra d’i Giganti sparte.
query.result:
**English:**
31 I saw Timbreo, I saw Pallas and Mars, 32 still armed, around their father, 33 watching the limbs of the Giants scattered about.
**Malay:**
31 Aku melihat Timbreo, aku melihat Pallas dan Mars, 32 masih bersenjata, di sekitar ayah mereka, 33 melihat anggota tubuh para Raksasa berserakan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Vedea Nembròt a piè del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, e riguardar le genti 36 che ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.
query.result:
**English:**
34 To see Nimrod at the foot of the great work 35 almost bewildered, and to look at the people 36 who in Shinar with him were proud.
**Malay:**
34 Melihat Nimrod di kaki pekerjaan besar itu 35 hampir bingung, dan melihat orang-orang 36 yang di Shinar dengannya sombong.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 O Nïobè, con che occhi dolenti 38 vedea io te segnata in su la strada, 39 tra sette e sette tuoi figliuoli spenti!
40 O Saùl, come in su la propria spada 41 quivi parevi morto in Gelboè, 42 che poi non sentì pioggia né rugiada!
43 O folle Aragne, sì vedea io te 44 già mezza ragna, trista in su li stracci 45 de l’opera che mal per te si fé.
query.result:
**English:**
37 O Niobe, with what sorrowful eyes 38 I saw you depicted on the road, 39 among your seven and seven slain children!
40 O Saul, how on your own sword 41 you seemed dead there in Gilboa, 42 which then felt neither rain nor dew!
43 O foolish Arachne, I saw you there 44 already half a spider, sadly on the tatters 45 of the work that was ill-done for you.
**Malay:**
37 Wahai Niobe, dengan mata yang sedih 38 kulihat engkau ditandai di jalan, 39 di antara tujuh dan tujuh anakmu yang terbunuh!
40 Wahai Saul, bagaimana di atas pedangmu sendiri 41 di sana engkau tampak mati di Gilboa, 42 yang kemudian tidak merasakan hujan atau embun!
43 Wahai Aragne yang bodoh, kulihat engkau di sana 44 sudah setengah laba-laba, sedih di atas koyakan-koyakan 45 dari pekerjaan yang buruk bagimu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 O Roboàm, già non par che minacci 47 quivi ’l tuo segno; ma pien di spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza ch’altri il cacci.
query.result:
**English:**
46 O Rehoboam, your emblem here 47 no longer seems to threaten; but in fear 48 a chariot bears it, without being driven.
**Malay:**
46 Wahai Rehoboam, di sini tidak lagi tampak 47 tanda milikmu itu mengancam; tetapi dengan ketakutan 48 sebuah kereta membawanya, tanpa ada yang mengejarnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Mostrava ancor lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fé caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.
query.result:
**English:**
49 The hard pavement still showed 50 how dear to his mother Almeon made 51 the ill-fated adornment appear.
**Malay:**
49 Permukaan tanah yang keras masih menunjukkan 50 bagaimana Almeon membuat ibunya sayang 51 pada perhiasan yang bernasib malang itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Mostrava come i figli si gittaro 53 sovra Sennacherìb dentro dal tempio, 54 e come, morto lui, quivi il lasciaro.
query.result:
**English:**
52 It showed how the sons threw themselves 53 upon Sennacherib inside the temple, 54 and how, after he was dead, they left him there.
**Malay:**
52 Menunjukkan bagaimana anak-anak melemparkan diri mereka 53 ke atas Sennacherib di dalam kuil, 54 dan bagaimana, setelah dia mati, mereka meninggalkannya di sana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 Mostrava la ruina e ’l crudo scempio 56 che fé Tamiri, quando disse a Ciro: 57 «Sangue sitisti, e io di sangue t’empio».
query.result:
**English:**
55 It showed the ruin and the cruel slaughter 56 that Tomyris inflicted on Cyrus when she said to him: 57 "You thirsted for blood, and I will fill you with blood."
**Malay:**
55 Menunjukkan kehancuran dan pembunuhan kejam 56 yang dilakukan Tomyris, ketika dia berkata kepada Cyrus: 57 "Kamu haus darah, dan aku akan memenuhinya dengan darah."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Mostrava come in rotta si fuggiro 59 li Assiri, poi che fu morto Oloferne, 60 e anche le reliquie del martiro.
query.result:
**English:**
58 It showed how the Assyrians fled in rout 59 after Holofernes was killed, 60 and also the relics of the martyrdom.
**Malay:**
58 Menunjukkan bagaimana orang Asyur melarikan diri dalam kekalahan 59 setelah Holofernes terbunuh, 60 dan juga relik-relik dari kemartiran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Vedeva Troia in cenere e in caverne; 62 o Ilïón, come te basso e vile 63 mostrava il segno che lì si discerne!
64 Qual di pennel fu maestro o di stile 65 che ritraesse l’ombre e ’ tratti ch’ivi 66 mirar farieno uno ingegno sottile?
67 Morti li morti e i vivi parean vivi: 68 non vide mei di me chi vide il vero, 69 quant’ io calcai, fin che chinato givi.
query.result:
**English:**
61 He saw Troy in ashes and in caverns; 62 O Ilium, how base and vile 63 you showed the sign that is discerned there!
64 What master of brush or pen 65 could portray the shadows and the lines 66 that there would make a subtle mind marvel?
67 The dead seemed dead and the living seemed alive: 68 no one who saw the truth saw more than I, 69 as I descended, until I went bowed down.
**Malay:**
61 Dia melihat Troia dalam abu dan gua; 62 O Ilium, betapa hina dan kejinya 63 engkau menunjukkan tanda yang terlihat di sana!
64 Pelukis atau penulis manakah 65 yang dapat menggambarkan bayangan dan garis-garis 66 yang di sana akan membuat pikiran yang tajam kagum?
67 Orang mati tampak mati dan orang hidup tampak hidup: 68 tidak ada yang melihat kebenaran lebih dariku, 69 ketika aku melangkah, hingga aku berjalan membungkuk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Or superbite, e via col viso altero, 71 figliuoli d’Eva, e non chinate il volto 72 sì che veggiate il vostro mal sentero!
73 Più era già per noi del monte vòlto 74 e del cammin del sole assai più speso 75 che non stimava l’animo non sciolto,
76 quando colui che sempre innanzi atteso 77 andava, cominciò: «Drizza la testa; 78 non è più tempo di gir sì sospeso.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Now bite it, and with haughty face, 71 sons of Eve, and do not bow your head 72 so that you may see your evil path!
73 More of the mountain was already turned for us 74 and of the sun's path much more spent 75 than my unfree mind had reckoned,
76 when he who always went on ahead 77 began to say: "Lift up your head; 78 it is no longer time to go so slowly.
**Malay:**
70 Sekarang gigitlah, dan dengan wajah angkuh, 71 anak-anak Hawa, dan jangan tundukkan kepala 72 sehingga kamu dapat melihat jalanmu yang jahat!
73 Lebih banyak gunung yang telah berputar untuk kita 74 dan perjalanan matahari jauh lebih banyak dihabiskan 75 daripada yang diperkirakan oleh pikiranku yang tidak bebas,
76 ketika dia yang selalu berjalan di depan 77 mulai berkata: "Angkat kepalamu; 78 bukan waktunya lagi untuk berjalan begitu lambat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Vedi colà un angel che s’appresta 80 per venir verso noi; vedi che torna 81 dal servigio del dì l’ancella sesta.
query.result:
**English:**
79 See there an angel who prepares 80 to come towards us; see that the handmaid of the sixth day 81 returns from her service.
**Malay:**
79 Lihatlah di sana seorang malaikat yang bersiap 80 untuk datang kepada kita; lihatlah bahwa pelayan hari keenam 81 kembali dari tugasnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Di reverenza il viso e li atti addorna, 83 sì che i diletti lo ’nvïarci in suso; 84 pensa che questo dì mai non raggiorna!».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Adorn your face and actions with reverence, 83 so that your delights may lead you upward; 84 think that this day will never dawn again!"
**Malay:**
82 Hiasi wajah dan tindakanmu dengan rasa hormat, 83 sehingga kesenanganmu dapat membawamu ke atas; 84 pikirkanlah bahwa hari ini tidak akan pernah terbit lagi!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Io era ben del suo ammonir uso 86 pur di non perder tempo, sì che ’n quella 87 materia non potea parlarmi chiuso.
query.result:
**English:**
85 I was well accustomed to his admonitions 86 so as not to waste time, so that in that 87 subject he could not speak to me obscurely.
**Malay:**
85 Aku sudah terbiasa dengan peringatannya 86 agar tidak membuang waktu, sehingga dalam 87 topik itu dia tidak dapat berbicara denganku secara samar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 A noi venìa la creatura bella, 89 biancovestito e ne la faccia quale 90 par tremolando mattutina stella.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Towards us came the beautiful creature, 89 dressed in white, and in her face 90 she seemed like a trembling morning star.
**Malay:**
88 Menuju kami datang makhluk yang cantik, 89 berpakaian putih, dan di wajahnya 90 ia tampak seperti bintang pagi yang bergetar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Le braccia aperse, e indi aperse l’ale; 92 disse: «Venite: qui son presso i gradi, 93 e agevolemente omai si sale.
query.result:
**English:**
91 He spread his arms, and then he spread his wings; 92 he said: "Come, here are the steps nearby, 93 and now it is easy to climb.
**Malay:**
91 Dia mengembangkan lengannya, dan kemudian mengembangkan sayapnya; 92 dia berkata: "Datanglah, di sinilah anak-anak tangganya, 93 dan sekarang mudah untuk memanjat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 A questo invito vegnon molto radi: 95 o gente umana, per volar sù nata, 96 perché a poco vento così cadi?».
query.result:
**English:**
94 To this invitation very few come: 95 O human race, born to fly upward, 96 why do you fall so easily at a little wind?
**Malay:**
94 Pada undangan ini sangat sedikit yang datang: 95 Wahai manusia, dilahirkan untuk terbang tinggi, 96 mengapa kamu begitu mudah jatuh karena angin sepoi-sepoi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Come a man destra, per salire al monte 101 dove siede la chiesa che soggioga 102 la ben guidata sopra Rubaconte,
103 si rompe del montar l’ardita foga 104 per le scalee che si fero ad etade 105 ch’era sicuro il quaderno e la doga;
106 così s’allenta la ripa che cade 107 quivi ben ratta da l’altro girone; 108 ma quinci e quindi l’alta pietra rade.
query.result:
**English:**
100 As a man on the right, to ascend the mountain 101 where sits the church that subjugates 102 the well-guided over Rubaconte,
103 breaks the bold eagerness to climb 104 because of the stairs that were made in an age 105 when the notebook and the cask were secure;
106 so the bank that falls 107 loosens itself there, quite steep from the other circle; 108 but here and there it scrapes the high stone.
**Malay:**
100 Seperti seorang lelaki di sebelah kanan, untuk mendaki gunung 101 di mana terletak gereja yang menaklukkan 102 yang dipandu dengan baik di atas Rubaconte,
103 mematahkan semangat yang berani untuk mendaki 104 karena tangga-tangga yang dibuat pada zaman 105 ketika buku catatan dan tong anggur aman;
106 maka tepi yang jatuh 107 melonggarkan dirinya di sana, cukup curam dari lingkaran lainnya; 108 tetapi di sana-sini ia mengikis batu yang tinggi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Noi volgendo ivi le nostre persone, 110 ‘Beati pauperes spiritu!’ voci 111 cantaron sì, che nol diria sermone.
query.result:
**English:**
109 We turning our persons thither, 110 ‘Blessed are the poor in spirit!’ voices 111 sang so that speech could not tell it.
**Malay:**
109 Kami memalingkan diri kami ke sana, 110 ‘Berbahagialah orang yang miskin dalam roh!’ suara-suara 111 bernyanyi sehingga ucapan tidak dapat menjelaskannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Ahi quanto son diverse quelle foci 113 da l’infernali! ché quivi per canti 114 s’entra, e là giù per lamenti feroci.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Ah, how different are those entrances 113 from the infernal ones! Because here one enters with songs, 114 and down there with fierce lamentations.
**Malay:**
112 Ah, betapa berbedanya pintu masuk itu 113 dari pintu masuk neraka! Karena di sini orang masuk dengan nyanyian, 114 dan di sana dengan ratapan yang ganas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Già montavam su per li scaglion santi, 116 ed esser mi parea troppo più lieve 117 che per lo pian non mi parea davanti.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Already we were climbing the holy stairs, 116 and it seemed to me to be much easier 117 than it had seemed to me on the plain below.
**Malay:**
115 Kami sudah mendaki tangga-tangga suci, 116 dan bagiku tampaknya jauh lebih mudah 117 daripada yang tampak bagiku di dataran di bawah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, qual cosa greve 119 levata s’è da me, che nulla quasi 120 per me fatica, andando, si riceve?».
query.result:
**English:**
118 Then I said: "Master, tell me, what heavy thing 119 has been lifted from me, that I feel almost 120 no fatigue in walking?".
**Malay:**
118 Lalu aku berkata: "Guru, katakanlah, apakah beban berat 119 telah terangkat dariku, sehingga hampir tidak ada 120 kelelahan yang kurasakan saat berjalan?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Rispuose: «Quando i P che son rimasi 122 ancor nel volto tuo presso che stinti, 123 saranno, com’ è l’un, del tutto rasi,
124 fier li tuoi piè dal buon voler sì vinti, 125 che non pur non fatica sentiranno, 126 ma fia diletto loro esser sù pinti».
query.result:
**English:**
121 He replied: "When the P's that have remained 122 still on your face, almost erased, 123 will be, like one of them, completely erased,
124 your feet will be so conquered by good will 125 that not only will you not feel fatigue, 126 but it will be a delight for them to be spurred on."
**Malay:**
121 Dia menjawab: "Ketika huruf P yang masih tersisa 122 di wajahmu hampir pudar, 123 akan, seperti salah satunya, benar-benar terhapus,
124 kakimu akan begitu ditaklukkan oleh keinginan baik 125 sehingga kamu tidak hanya tidak merasakan lelah, 126 tetapi akan menyenangkan bagi mereka untuk didorong."
